org.openimaj.image.processing.convolution

Class FImageConvolveSeparable

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.image.processing.convolution.FImageConvolveSeparable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageProcessor<FImage>, Processor<FImage>, SinglebandImageProcessor<Float,FImage>

    public class FImageConvolveSeparable
extends Object
implements SinglebandImageProcessor<Float,FImage>
    Image processor for separable convolution of an FImage. Capable of doing convolution in either the vertical, horizontal or both directions.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.openimaj.image.processor.SinglebandImageProcessor

        SinglebandImageProcessor.Processable<T,S extends Image<T,S>,I extends Image<?,I>>

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FImageConvolveSeparable(float[] kernel)
      Specify a single kernel to be used as the horizontal and vertical.
      FImageConvolveSeparable(float[] hkernel, float[] vkernel)
      Specify the horizontal kernel and vertical kernel separately.

    • Method Detail

      • processImage

        public void processImage(FImage image)
        Description copied from interface: ImageProcessor
        Process an image. Implementing classes must alter the image passed in-place or assign the output to the input using Image.internalAssign(Image).
        Specified by:
        processImage in interface ImageProcessor<FImage>
        Parameters:

      • convolveBuffer

        protected static void convolveBuffer(float[] buffer,
                                     float[] kernel)

      • convolveHorizontal

        public static void convolveHorizontal(FImage image,
                                      float[] kernel)
        Convolve the image in the horizontal direction with the kernel. Edge effects are handled by duplicating the edge pixels.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to convolve.
        kernel - the convolution kernel.

      • convolveVertical

        public static void convolveVertical(FImage image,
                                    float[] kernel)
        Convolve the image in the vertical direction with the kernel. Edge effects are handled by duplicating the edge pixels.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to convolve.
        kernel - the convolution kernel.

      • fastConvolve3

        public static void fastConvolve3(FImage source,
                                 FImage dest,
                                 float[] kx,
                                 float[] ky,
                                 float[] buffer)
        Fast convolution for separated 3x3 kernels. Only valid pixels are considered, so the output image bounds will be two pixels smaller than the input image on all sides (the response of the kernel to the source pixel at 1,1 is stored in the destination image at 0,0)
        Parameters:
        source - the source image
        dest - the destination image
        kx - the x-kernel (can be null, implying [0 1 0] )
        ky - the y-kernel (can be null, implying [0 1 0])
        buffer - the working buffer (can be null, but ideally the same width as the source image)
